content.description:
An off-width, flaring dihedral that offers a challenging crack/chimney combo. Tape up for this one, or expect to lose skin. 

For the last year or so a Raven's nest has been directly on top of this climb. Please don't climb if there is any indication of the birds.
content.location: This is the first (and rightmost,) route you encounter when you approach the Cracks area. You can rap from the anchors at the top of the Beginner Slab.

climbs.name: Skinners Route
climbs.fa: TR Todd Skinner FFA Sam Powell

content.description: This route was famously TR'ed by Todd Skinner on a visit to Wintergreen. I added a bolt or two to make it a solid mixed climb. It's been 20 years since I've been on this, so it could have been 12a or 12c, so I split the difference and went with 12b.
content.location: This is the sharp arete 10 ft left of Hero's and Handlebars

content.description: From rockclimbing.com:"Start 10 ft left of Unhappy Cracks. Climb up and left behind a large flake then straight up past an overhanging boulder to the rap station."Basically, start in the corner near Unhappy Crack and follow the crack that veers left to the tooth flake. From there, go straight up and fight the vegetation to the topout. Not particularly worth it, but it is a way to set up a TR for Happy Cracks without having to do the awkward double rap.
content.protection: Standard rack is more than sufficient. Be ready to excavate.
content.location: Head to the Cracks area. Once there, look for the tooth-like flake. This route starts about 6-8ft right of this flake.

content.description: Place a directional from standing height, and climb the thin face through edges and seams, placing pro where you can because it's mostly tiny. Get up to the small angling roof, climb right to, and up the corner. After pulling out of the corner, follow the crack system up to the top.
content.protection: Singles from tiny to hands, stoppers, and brass/micronuts are a must for down low. Shared anchor with Happy Cracks (large pine up top with webbing and rap rings)
content.location:
Directly to the left of Happy Cracks. Starts on the thin face/seams below the small right leaning roof that leads to the short right facing corner. 

  I don't have a photo, but the climb can be seen in the main photograph for the The Cracks area. To the left of the crack system that the climber is on, it's the corner/face to the left.

content.description: This is a classic 5.8, and great practice for any aspiring trad leader! Two parallel cracks that eat up pro, and with two distinct cruxes. Start off with a tricky move out from under a roof to access the cracks. The second crux is two thirds of the way up when the crack shifts to a layback for 6 feet or so.
content.protection: Medium gear and nuts. There are fixed slings with rap rings around a big pine at the top. You can rap down to the tree from the overlook on the Plunge if you want to set up a TR.

content.description: Fun left-facing dihedral to the left of Happy Hands. Don't let the moss and the small mountain laurel scare you away from this one! Climb the dihedral and follow the widening crack to the Happy Hands anchor.
There are a handful of routes and projects here, along with two of the most classic crack climbs at Wintergreen. Directly around the corner from the Beginner Slab.
